Ok, guys, serioustly, quit it. Rudra and Kinger, this whole battle 
between you two has been marked with stretching and breaking of the 
rules, and I've had to comment to both of you by now.

Unless you can get your act together (start from before Kinger's 
chars tried to place the bomb on Amperion and go from there without 
moding), I will ask (and inforce) that you two be returned to the CR 
chambers of your respective bases, all three bots in stasis lock.

Thank you and have a good day.





--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Rudra656@a... wrote:
> (I can't let him die just yet he's a favorite of mine.  I will 
withdraw this 
> post if told to do so by one of the moderators.)
> 
> ::Amperion::
>     He was happy now, or would have been if he was awake, that he 
had taken 
> the time to pick up the holographic emitter that had been used to 
trick him 
> in the cave.  He also would have been happy that he had reprogramed 
it to 
> become an image of him centered on the emitter itself.  The final 
thing was 
> pure luck he dropped it in the battle and landed on it when he 
fell.  It 
> turned on and created the hologram over where he was lying.  The 
first shots 
> hit him and dealt significant damage but they also knocked him 
backwards away 
> from the explosions.  The shots dealt less and less damage as the 
blew him 
> farther away.  Because the emitter was centered on his body and 
small it 
> remained functional, moving only slightly.  It also was programmed 
to hide 
> him from sight so that they could not notice that he was no longer 
getting 
> hit.
